glsa.title: HAProxy: Arbitrary code execution
glsa.synopsis: A buffer overflow in HAProxy may allow execution of arbitrary code.

background.p: HAProxy is a TCP/HTTP reverse proxy for high availability environments.

description.p: A boundary error in HAProxy could cause a buffer overflow when header rewriting is enabled and the configuration sets global.tune.bufsize to a value greater than the default (16384 bytes).

impact.p: A remote attacker could possibly execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the process or cause a Denial of Service condition.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.

resolution.p: All HAProxy users should upgrade to the latest version:
